intro: Euphrasia × ruscinonensis, commonly known as the hybrid eyebright, is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers with prominent yellow markings, typically blooming in early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shady areas. Due to its hybrid origin, it exhibits a variety of morphological traits that distinguish it from its parent species.
